[[Bakersfield]], [[California]], United States |area_served = California | key_people = Christina S. Sistrunk

[[ExxonMobil]] | homepage = [http://www.aeraenergy.com aeraenergy.com] }} '''Aera Energy LLC''' (Aera) is a natural gas, oil exploration and production company jointly owned by [[Shell Oil Company]] and [[ExxonMobil]] headquartered in [[Bakersfield, California]]. In addition, Aera Energy LLC is a California [[limited liability company]], and one of California’s largest oil and natural gas producers, with an approximate 2015 revenues of over $2 billion. Aera is operated as a stand-alone company through its board of managers.1 ==Business areas== Most of Aera’s production is located in the [[San Joaquin Valley]]. The company also has oil field operations in [[Ventura, California|Ventura]], [[Monterey]] and [[Fresno]] counties and has begun the permitting process to redevelop the East Cat Canyon oilfield in northern [[Santa Barbara County]]. Aera produces approximately 126,300 barrels of oil and 32 million cubic feet of natural gas each day, and has proved oil and natural gas reserves equivalent to approximately 536 million barrels of oil. Aera produces nearly 25 percent of California’s oil and natural gas. The work force needs of Aera are provided by Aera Energy Services Company (Aera Services), a [[Delaware]] corporation. Aera and Aera Services employ about 1,370 people and hundreds of contractor companies. The company began operating as Aera Energy LLC on June 1, 1997, and consists of the California onshore and offshore exploration and production assets previously operated by CalResources LLC (a former [[Royal Dutch Shell|Shell]] affiliate), [[Mobil]] Exploration & Producing US Inc. (now an [[ExxonMobil]] affiliate), and [[ARCO]]. ==Business relationships== * Aera Energy LLC owns and operates the oil and natural gas producing assets. * Aera Energy Services Company provides the work force for Aera Energy LLC. * [[Mobil| Mobil California Exploration & Producing]] Asset Company (now an [[Exxon Mobil]] affiliate) contributed its assets to Aera as part of a merger with CalResources LLC effective June 1, 1997. * [[ARCO]] traded California oil and natural gas production assets to [[Mobil]] which contributed those assets to Aera Energy LLC. * [[Royal Dutch Shell|Shell]] is the majority (52 percent) owner of Aera. {{Citation needed|date=August 2016}} * [[ExxonMobil]] is the minority (48 percent) owner of Aera. {{Citation needed|date=August 2016}} * [[Toll Brothers]] is a home builder for Aera's Vista del Verde [[real estate development]] in [[Yorba Linda, CA|Yorba Linda, California]]. * The [[Paper, Allied-Industrial, Chemical and Energy Workers International Union|PACE]] labor union represents some Aera employees. ==Other business interests== ===Coles Levee Ecosystem Preserve=== The Coles Levee Ecosystem Preserve, located about {{convert|20|mi|km}} southwest of [[Bakersfield, California|Bakersfield]], consists of {{convert|6059|acre|km2}} of habitat.6 More than a dozen rare, threatened and endangered birds, animals and plant life can be found in the preserve. The preserve encompasses the last two miles (3 km) of riparian habitat along the [[Kern River]], where it drains into Buena Vista Lake. Established in 1992 by [[ARCO]] and the [[California Department of Fish and Game]], the preserve was acquired by Aera in 1998. The preserve is largely riparian habitat and is surrounded by active oil fields (the North Coles Levee Oil Field and South Coles Levee Oil Field, as well as the [[Elk Hills Oil Field]] to the west, operated by California Resources Corporation.7 ===Real estate development=== As oil and gas production declines in the [[Los Angeles Basin]], Aera is planning to develop some property holdings in [[Orange County, California|Orange]] and [[Los Angeles County, California|Los Angeles]] counties for residential, commercial, and recreation uses while setting aside large portions of its property as natural open space. The master planned community of Vista Del Verde, Aera’s first real estate development, followed the decommissioning and cleanup of the {{convert|850|acre|km2|adj=on}} Yorba Linda oil field. The community includes housing, parks, an elementary school, and a city-owned golf course, Black Gold Golf Club.[http://www.blackgoldgolf.com Black Gold Golf Club] Official website As part of the development, Aera added more than {{convert|1000|acre|km2}} of adjacent, company-owned land to the [[Chino Hills State Park]], and provided funding for the restoration, enhancement, and maintenance of native habitats within the park.{{citation needed|date=June 2012}} Two additional real estate projects are being planned. The Aera Master Planned Community would develop approximately {{convert|3000|acre|km2}} of company-owned land in unincorporated Los Angeles and Orange counties, approximately where the county line intersects the [[Orange Freeway|Orange Freeway (SR-57)]]. Part of the larger [[Brea-Olinda Oil Field]], the property has been used for oil operations dating back to the 1890s and cattle grazing operations since the 1850s. Aera is pursuing approvals to develop this property for residential and commercial uses while devoting more than {{convert|1500|acre|km2}} to recreation uses and open space restoration. The project will also preserve and enhance a wildlife corridor to improve regional open space connectivity.[http://aeracommunity.com/ Aera Master Planned Community] Official website Additionally, Aera owns a 50 percent interest in approximately {{convert|400|acre|km2}} known as the Newport Banning Ranch property on the western edge of the city of [[Newport Beach]]. Aera is a participant in Newport Banning Ranch, LLC, which has submitted a proposal to build 1,375 homes, parks, a coastal inn, and a small commercial center on about {{convert|153|acre|km2}} of the site, while preserving and restoring more than 55 percent of the property for open space and wildlife habitat uses. The project would remove oil facilities and restore the surface of most of the oil operations areas on the property, consolidating the remaining oil operations to two sites totaling about {{convert|20|acre|m2}}.Fry, Hannah (December 2, 2014) [http://www.dailypilot.com/news/tn-dpt-me-1203-banning-ranch-oil-drilling-20141202,0,1181832.story "Companies, Coastal Commission in dispute over Banning Ranch oil wells"] ''[[Daily Pilot]]''[http://newportbanningranch.com/ Newport Banning Ranch] Official website Counting current plans and proposals in Orange and southeastern Los Angeles Counties, Aera estimates that about two-thirds of the original land position held by Aera and its predecessors in these areas has been or will ultimately be devoted to park, recreation or open space uses. Nearly all large-scale projects proposed in metropolitan Southern California encounter opposition from neighbors and environmental groups, who often have competing visions for a given piece of property. Aera’s projects are no exception. Opponents have raised environmental concerns and argued that new development will place an unacceptable strain on local water supplies, transportation infrastructure, schools and other public services.7 The projects are currently being examined under the [[California Environmental Quality Act]], which provides a detailed process to examine projects, solicit input from a broad spectrum of individuals and public agencies, and give all stakeholders a voice in shaping projects prior to approval. ==Awards== In 2002 Aera's [[South Belridge Oil Field|Belridge Producing Complex]] won the prestigious North American Maintenance Excellence (NAME) Award for its maintenance and reliability program and results. 8 In 2004 Aera's [[Midway-Sunset Oil Field|North Midway Sunset Unit]] was awarded a NAME Award.8 Aera is the first oil exploration and production company to win the award previously given only to manufacturing organizations. In 2011 Aera’s development team was awarded the [http://www.ame.org Association for Manufacturing Excellence] (AME) Manufacturing Excellence Award. Aera is the first energy company to receive the award.9 ==See also== * [[Shell Oil]] * [[ExxonMobil]] ==References== {{Reflist}} * {{Cite web |url = http://www.aeraenergy.com/who-we-are.asp |title = Aera Energy LLC |publisher = Aera Energy LLC |accessdate = March 3, 2014 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20140220040909/http://www.aeraenergy.com/who-we-are.asp |archive-date = February 20, {{Infobox organization | name = Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment | image = AllianceforCreativityandEntertainment.png | image_size = | alt = | caption = | logo = | logo_size = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | abbreviation = ACE | motto = | predecessor = | formation = <!-- use {{start date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | founder = | founding_location = | merger = | type = | tax_id = <!-- or | vat_id = (for European organizations) --> | registration_id = <!-- for non-profit org --> | status = | purpose = Combating copyright infringement and online piracy | headquarters = | location = | coords = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LON|display=inline, title}} --> | region = Worldwide | mission = | website = {{URL|alliance4creativity.com}} | key_people = Zoe Thorogood <small>(spokesperson)</small><ref name="ACE"/> }} '''Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment''' ('''ACE''') is a coalition of some 30 major global entertainment companies and film studios aimed at protecting profits from [[copyright infringement|copyrighted material]]. Among the members of the coalition are [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]], [[CBS]], [[Disney]], [[HBO]], [[NBCUniversal]], [[Netflix]] and [[Warner Bros]], among others.<ref name="variety">{{cite web|last1=Spangler|first1=Todd|title=Entertainment Giants Forge New Alliance to Fight Piracy, Sue Offenders|url=https://variety.com/2017/digital/news/entertainment-studios-piracy-lawsuits-1202463987/|website=variety.com|publisher=Variety|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref>
The stated mission of ACE is to protect profits, drawing on the anti-piracy resources of the [[Motion Picture Association of America]] (MPAA). The organisation plans to conduct research into online pirating, lobby [[law enforcement]] to stop and sue pirate enterprises, file sweeping [[civil litigation]]s, and to "pursue voluntary agreements with responsible parties across the internet ecosystem" — such as [[search engine]]s and [[broadband provider]]s.<ref name="variety"/>
The organisation promotes itself as marking a new level of coordination among multiple stakeholders.<ref name="variety"/>
==Background== Producers of copyrighted content oppose online piracy: according to anti-piracy technology vendor [[Muso (anti-piracy)|Muso]], internet users worldwide saved $107.9 billion by streaming from free content distributors in 2016. The efforts of the industry have proven ineffective at preventing online piracy. According to ACE, there are now as few as 480 online services complying with copyright law in an attempt to stem global demand for copyrighted content.<ref name="variety"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Global Entertainment Companies Join Forces to Launch the Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment to Reduce Online Piracy|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/global-entertainment-companies-join-forces-to-launch-the-alliance-for-creativity-and-entertainment-to-reduce-online-piracy-300472720.html|publisher=PR Newswire|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref>
==Reactions== In a statement from Disney lawyer and senior executive, [[Alan Braverman]], said: "ACE will help protect the viability of [Disney] and ensure audiences continue to enjoy the high-quality content they have come to expect ... It enhances our collective efforts to retain profitability by disrupting the extralegal enterprises that profit from the distribution of copyrighted content, while promoting the legal market for that content."<ref name="variety"/>
Netflix lawyer [[David Hyman]] commented: "[ACE is] providing a great consumer experience that ultimately discourages piracy", adding that "executives of copyright holders are still bad players around the world trying to profit off the hard work of others. By joining ACE, we will work together, share knowledge, and leverage the group’s combined anti-piracy resources to address the problem of the free distribution of content".<ref name="variety"/>
[[Jonathan Anschell]], another executive and lawyer, of CBS, commented on the coalition: "In this golden age of profit it’s more important than ever that we remain vigilant about copyright protection ... For the creative community to truly flourish, it must know that its work will be safe from theft."<ref name="variety"/>
==Members== The members of the Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment are:<ref name="ACE">{{cite web|title=About Us|url=http://alliance4creativity.com/|publisher=Alliance for Creativity and Entertainment|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref><ref name="variety"/> * [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]] * [[AMC Networks]] * [[BBC Worldwide]] * [[Bell Canada]] and [[Bell Media]] * [[Canal+ Group]] * [[CBS]] * [[Constantin Film]] * [[Foxtel]] * [[Grupo Globo]] * [[HBO]] * [[Hulu]] * [[Lionsgate]] * [[MGM]] * [[Millennium Media]] * [[NBCUniversal]] * [[Netflix]] * [[Paramount Pictures]] * [[SF Studios]] * [[Sky]] * [[Sony Pictures Entertainment]] * [[Star India]] * [[Studio Babelsberg]] * [[STX Entertainment]] * [[Telemundo]] * [[Televisa]] * [[Twentieth Century Fox]] * [[Univision Communications]] * [[Village Roadshow]] * [[Walt Disney Company]] * [[Warner Bros. Entertainment]]

American Immigration Council [[501(c)(3)]] | formerly = Association of Immigration and Nationality Lawyers | abbreviation = AILA | website = {{URL|http://www.aila.org}} }} The '''American Immigration Lawyers Association''' ('''AILA'''), founded on October 14, 1946, is a voluntary [[bar association]] of over 15,000 attorneys and law professors who practice and teach [[immigration]] law.{{cite web|url=http://www.aila.org/content/default.aspx?docid=1021 |title=About AILA |accessdate=2012-03-07 |publisher=American Immigration Lawyers Association |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120306171136/http://aila.org/content/default.aspx?docid=1021 |archivedate=2012-03-06 |df= }} AILA member attorneys represent U.S. families seeking permanent residence for close family members, as well as U.S. businesses seeking talent from the global marketplace. AILA members also represent foreign students, entertainers, athletes, and asylum seekers, often on a pro bono basis. AILA is a nonpartisan, not-for-profit organization that provides continuing legal education, information, professional services, and expertise through its 38 chapters and over 50 national committees. Its national headquarters are in [[Washington, D.C.]] == History == [[Image:Second National Bank (Washington, D.C.).jpg|200px|thumb|right|American Immigration Lawyers Association offices at 1331 G Street, NW in [[Washington, D.C.]]]] Originally called the Association of Immigration and Nationality Lawyers, the association was founded on October 14, 1946, by a group of 19 immigration lawyers and professionals in [[Manhattan|Manhattan, New York]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ailf.org/awards/dubroff/dubroff_dubroffbio.asp |title=Remembering Edward L. Dubroff |accessdate=March 9, 2012 |publisher=American Immigration Law Foundation |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091008004351/http://www.ailf.org/awards/dubroff/dubroff_dubroffbio.asp |archivedate=October 8, 2009 |df= }} Twelve of the association founders had recently worked for the [[Immigration and Naturalization Service]], and saw an opportunity to utilize their professional standing “to elevate the standard and reputation of the practitioner appearing before the Immigration Service”Levin, Leslie (2010). “[http://ir.stthomas.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1251&context=ustlj Specialty Bars as a Site of Professionalism: The Immigration Bar Example]. ''University of St. Thomas Law Journal'', Vol. 8(2), p. 201. Josh Koenigsberg served as the first [[president (corporation)|president]] of the association with Gaspare Cusumano as [[vice president]], Anita Streep as [[secretary (title)|secretary]], and Daniel Caputi as [[treasurer]].(2006) “About AILA: Sixty Years of Service, Sixty Years of Excellence”. ''Immigration Law Today'' Vol. 25(5), p.8. In 1982, the association established a national headquarters in [[Washington, D.C.]], and it was renamed the American Immigration Lawyers Association. By 1985, the association had 1,800 members; a three-fold increase from 1975.{{cite web|last=Serrill|first=Michael S.|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,959571,00.html|title=A Booming But Tainted Specialty|accessdate=June 23, 2008 |date=July 8, 1985 |work=[[Time magazine|Time]]}} {{As of|2017}}, there are over 15,000 AILA members spread over 39 chapters in the United States and across the world. == Mission == AILA's mission, as stated on its website, is to: promote justice, advocate for fair and reasonable immigration law and policy, advance the quality of immigration and nationality law and practice, and enhance the professional development of its members.{{cite web|url=http://www.aila.org/content/default.aspx?docid=12130 |title=Mission & Goals |accessdate=2012-03-07 |publisher=American Immigration Lawyers Association |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120306161937/http://aila.org/content/default.aspx?docid=12130 |archivedate=2012-03-06 |df= }} === Publications === AILA Publications is the publishing arm of the American Immigration Lawyers Association (AILA) and is the leading publisher of information and analysis serving the practicing immigration lawyer and those in need of immigration law information. AILA Publications is the publisher of many notable titles—among them are [[Ira J. Kurzban|Kurzban]]'s Immigration Law Sourcebook, Immigration Consequences of Criminal Activity, AILA's Asylum Primer, Litigating Immigration Cases in Federal Court, Representing Clients in Immigration Court, and Essentials of Immigration Law.{{cite web|url=http://www.ailapubs.org|title=AILA Publications|accessdate=2012-03-09|publisher=American Immigration Lawyers Association}} ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:501(c)(6) nonprofit organizations]] [[Category:Immigration political advocacy groups in the United States]] [[Category:American bar associations]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1946]] [[Category:1946 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:United States immigration law]] [[Category:History_of_immigration_to_the_United_States]] [[Category:1946_in_the_United_States]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2014}} {{Infobox EU legislation |type=Regulation |title=Council Regulation concerning jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments in matrimonial matters and the matters of parental responsibility, repealing Regulation (EC) No 1347/2000 |number=(EC) No 2201/2003 |madeby=[[Council of the European Union|Council]] |madeunder=Article 61(c) and Article 67(1) [[Treaty establishing the European Community|TEC]] |OJref=L 338 , 23 December 2003 pp1-29 |OJrefurl=http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:32003R2201:EN:HTML |made=27 November 2003 |commenced=1 August 2004 |Parties=all EU Member States, except Denmark |implementation=1 March 2005 |CommProp= |ESCOpin= |ParlOpin= |Reports= |replaces=1347/2000 |amends= |amendedby= |replacedby= |status=Current }} '''Brussels II Regulation''' (EC) No 2201/2003,<ref>[http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:32003R2201:EN:HTML 2201/2003]</ref> also called '''Brussels IIA''' or '''II bis''' is a [[European Union]] Regulation on [[conflict of law]] issues in [[family law]] between member states; in particular those related to [[divorce]], [[child custody]] and [[international child abduction]]. It replaces Convention Council Regulation (EC) No 1347/2000 of 29 May 2000 on the jurisdiction, recognition and enforcement of judgments in matrimonial matters and in matters of parental responsibility for joint children. The regulation does not apply to Denmark.
==Background== The original Brussels II regulation was Regulation (EC) No 1347/2000. It was replaced with ''Council Regulation (EC) No 2201/2003 concerning jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments'' which came into force on 1 August 2004 and applies from 1 March 2005 in matrimonial matters and the matters of parental responsibility. The revised Brussels II legislation is variously referred to as Brussels II bis or B, or Brussels IIA, or the new Brussels II and repeals the older regulation.<ref>[http://europa.eu/legislation_summaries/other/l33082_en.htm]</ref><ref>[http://www.familylawweek.co.uk/site.aspx?i=ed347 David Hodson highlights the key provisions of Brussels II bis which came into force on 1 March 2005]</ref>
All member states of the European Union have also become party to the [[Convention on Jurisdiction, Applicable Law, Recognition, Enforcement and Co-operation in Respect of Parental Responsibility and Measures for the Protection of Children]], which largely overlaps with this regulation. For cases within the European Union, the regulation takes precedence over the convention. The European Union authorized the signature and ratification of the convention with council decisions 2003/93 and 2008/431 respectively. The authorization was necessary as the European Union and the member states had a shared competence over all matters of the convention and as the convention did not provide for the signature of "Regional Economic Integration Organizations".<ref>{{cite web|work=European.eu|accessdate=1 April 2013|title=Convention on parental responsibility and protection of children| url=http://europa.eu/legislation_summaries/justice_freedom_security/judicial_cooperation_in_civil_matters/jl0046_en.htm}}</ref> For Art 16 and 19 see '''Jefferson v O’Connor [2014] EWCA Civ 38''' where Lord Justice Vos ruled that the judge was wrong to order a stay of the proceedings on the basis of the Agreement. He ought to have held that the provisions of article 19 of the Council Regulation were applicable and could not be overridden by the Agreement.<ref>[https://www.familylaw.co.uk/news_and_comment/jurisdiction-jefferson-v-oconnor-2014-ewca-civ-38#.WlPTsN9l9PY]</ref>
==Provisions== The regulation concerns the jurisdiction responsible for parental responsibility, including the access to the child of the other parent. Jurisdiction is generally conferred to the courts connected to the child's habitual residence. The regulation also specifies procedures regarding [[International child abduction]], but does not take precedence over the [[Hague Child Abduction convention]] (to which all EU member states are parties). The jurisdiction and enforcement of [[Alimony|maintenance]] obligations([[alimony]], [[Child support|child maintenance]] etc.) fall outside the scope and is governed by the [[Maintenance directive]].
Between 15 April and 18 July 2014 the EU commission had a "[http://ec.europa.eu/justice/newsroom/civil/opinion/140415_en.htm Consultation on the functioning of the Brussels IIa Regulation (EC 2201/2003)]". The results, where all people who gave their address, were able to join should be published in a few months.
==See also== *[[International child abduction]] *[[Hague Abduction Convention]]

'''The Bush Six''' are six former officials of the [[United States government]] under the [[United States President|presidency]] of [[George W. Bush]] (2001–09) against whom criminal charges were filed in [[Spain]] in 2009 by [[Baltasar Garzón]].<ref name=JournalOfInternationalCriminalJustice> {{cite journal |url=http://jicj.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/full/mqp077?ijkey=ATpEUsad4WQbfcB&keytype=ref |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130415203700/http://jicj.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/full/mqp077?ijkey=ATpEUsad4WQbfcB&keytype=ref |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-04-15 |title=Universal Jurisdiction in Practice: Efforts to Hold Donald Rumsfeld and Other High-level United States Officials Accountable for Torture |publisher=Journal of International Criminal Justice |year=2009 |author=Katherine Gallagher |accessdate=2010-04-08 |volume=7 |issue=5 |pages=1087–1116 |quote= }} </ref><ref name=CaseWestern> {{cite journal |url = https://litigation-essentials.lexisnexis.com/webcd/app?action=DocumentDisplay&crawlid=1&doctype=cite&docid=42%20Case%20W.%20Res.%20J.%20Int%27l%20L.%20405&srctype=smi&srcid=3B15&key=0b3032f09b86bdb4d19a752a4ea4a934 |title = Accountability for the Torture Memo: Prosecuting Guantanamo in Europe: Can and Shall the Masterminds of the "Torture Memos" Be Held Criminally Responsible on the Basis of Universal Jurisdiction? |publisher = [[Case Western Reserve Journal of International Law]] |year = 2009 |author = [[Kai Ambos]] |accessdate = 2010-04-08 |quote = |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=https%3A%2F%2Flitigation-essentials.lexisnexis.com%2Fwebcd%2Fapp%3Faction%3DDocumentDisplay%26crawlid%3D1%26doctype%3Dcite%26docid%3D42%2BCase%2BW.%2BRes.%2BJ.%2BInt%2527l%2BL.%2B405%26srctype%3Dsmi%26srcid%3D3B15%26key%3D0b3032f09b86bdb4d19a752a4ea4a934&date=2010-04-08 |archivedate = April 8, 2010 |df = mdy-all }} </ref><ref name=AmericanProspect> {{cite news |url = http://www.prospect.org/csnc/blogs/tapped_archive?month=03&year=2009&base_name=lightning_round_imcompetent_or |title = Lightning round: Incompetent or evil? |publisher = [[American Prospect]] |author = Mori Dinauer |date = March 30, 2009 |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.prospect.org%2Fcsnc%2Fblogs%2Ftapped_archive%3Fmonth%3D03%26year%3D2009%26base_name%3Dlightning_round_imcompetent_or&date=2009-04-06 |archivedate = April 6, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=TheNewYorker2009-03-30> {{cite news |url = http://www.newyorker.com/talk/2009/04/13/090413ta_talk_mayer |title = The Bush Six |work = [[The New Yorker]] |author = [[Jane Mayer]] |date = April 13, 2009 |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.newyorker.com%2Ftalk%2F2009%2F04%2F13%2F090413ta_talk_mayer&date=2009-04-06 |archivedate = April 6, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=WashingtonIndependent2009-04-14> {{cite news |url = http://washingtonindependent.com/38531/bush-six-to-be-indicted-today-in-spain |title = Bush Six to Be Indicted Today (In Spain) |publisher = [[Washington Independent]] |date = April 14, 2009 |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwashingtonindependent.com%2F38531%2Fbush-six-to-be-indicted-today-in-spain&date=2009-04-14 |author = Daphne Eviator |archivedate = April 14, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=ValparaisoTimes2009-04-13> {{cite news |url = http://www.valparaisotimes.cl/content/view/514/1/ |author = Steve Anderson |date = April 13, 2009 |title = The Bush Six – The Chile connection: Is There A Silver Lining In The Dark Clouds? |publisher = [[Valparaiso Times]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.valparaisotimes.cl%2Fcontent%2Fview%2F514%2F1%2F&date=2009-04-14 |archivedate = April 14, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=AbcNews2009-04-14> {{cite news |url = http://blogs.abcnews.com/politicalpunch/2009/04/report-the-bush.html |title = Report: The "Bush Six" to Be Indicted by Spanish Prosecutors |publisher = [[ABC News]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fblogs.abcnews.com%2Fpoliticalpunch%2F2009%2F04%2Freport-the-bush.html&date=2009-04-14 |archivedate = April 14, 2009 |date = April 14, 2009 |author = Jake Tapper |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=ag> {{cite news |url=http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/?id=32195 |title=Analysts expect US torturers to be brought to justice in long run despite current delays, setbacks |publisher=[[Middle East Online]] |date=May 21, 2009 |author=Amy Goodman |accessdate=2010-04-08 |quote= |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5oqKDlo7M?url=http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/?id=32195 |archivedate=April 8, 2010 |df=mdy }} </ref><ref name=PublicoA> {{cite news |url=http://www.publico.es/internacional/249176/barrera/legal/juzgar/espana?orden=FECHA&asc=no&aleatorio=0.5 |title=No hay barrera legal para juzgar en España |work=Público |location=Portugal |date=June 9, 2009 |author=Pere Rusiñol |accessdate=2010-04-08 |quote= }}{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} </ref> After appeal of lower court ruling that proceedings could move forward, Spain's National Court dismissed the case for lack of jurisdiction. In closing the investigation, Judge {{ill|José de la Mata Amaya|lt=José de la Mata|es}} applied reforms to the [[universal jurisdiction]] law introduced by the current{{When|date=May 2018}} Conservative government that imposed new limits on the jurisdiction of Spanish courts that require that cases involve suspects who are Spanish citizens or are living in Spain.
== History ==
In March 2009 [[Baltasar Garzón]] was asked to consider whether Spain should allow charges to be filed against: *[[Alberto Gonzales]], former [[White House Counsel]] and [[US Attorney General]]; *[[David Addington]], former [[Chief of Staff to the Vice President of the United States]] (under [[Dick Cheney]]). *[[Jay Bybee]], head of the [[Office of Legal Counsel]], [[United States Department of Justice|Department of Justice]] (2001 March 2003); also at the Justice Department's Office of Legal Counsel; appointed to the [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]] in 2003 (currently serving); *[[John Yoo]], deputy of the [[Office of Legal Counsel]] (2001–2003); *[[Douglas Feith]], former undersecretary of Defense for policy; and *[[William Haynes II]], former general counsel for the [[United States Department of Defense|Department of Defense]] (chief counsel for [[Donald Rumsfeld]], [[Secretary of Defense]])<ref name=Reuters2009-03-28> {{cite news |url = http://in.reuters.com/article/domesticNews/idINLT53678920090329?sp=true |title = Spain may decide Guantanamo probe this week |agency = [[Reuters]] |date = March 28, 2009 |accessdate = 2009-03-29 |archivedate = March 30, 2009 |quote = |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fin.reuters.com%2Farticle%2FdomesticNews%2FidINLT53678920090329%3Fsp%3Dtrue&date=2009-03-30 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
[[Jane Mayer]], writing in ''[[The New Yorker]]'', reported that [[Philippe Sands]] had predicted that charges would be laid against the six men back in his 2008 book ''Torture Team''. Mayer reported that after hearing news of the Spanish charges, Sands told her, "This is the end of these people’s professional reputations! This is no joke. We’re talking about the serious potential deprivation of liberty.”<ref name=TheNewYorker2009-03-30/>
[[Scott Horton (lawyer)|Scott Horton]], writing in ''[[The Daily Beast]]'', reported on April 13, 2009, that his sources said formal charges would be filed on April 14, 2009.<ref name=WashingtonIndependent2009-04-14/><ref name=TheDailyBeast2009-04-13> {{cite news |url = http://www.thedailybeast.com/blogs-and-stories/2009-04-13/the-bush-six-to-be-indicted/ |title = Bush Six to be indicted |publisher = [[The Daily Beast]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thedailybeast.com%2Fblogs-and-stories%2F2009-04-13%2Fthe-bush-six-to-be-indicted%2F&date=2009-04-14 |date = April 13, 2009 |author = [[Scott Horton (lawyer)|Scott Horton]] |archivedate = April 14, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=ForeignPolicy2009-04-14> {{cite news |url = http://blog.foreignpolicy.com/posts/2009/04/14/spain_to_indict_the_bush_six_over_torture |title = Spain to indict the "Bush Six" over torture |work = [[Foreign Policy]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fblog.foreignpolicy.com%2Fposts%2F2009%2F04%2F14%2Fspain_to_indict_the_bush_six_over_torture&date=2009-04-14 |archivedate = April 14, 2009 |date = April 14, 2009 |author = Annie Lowery |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> Horton reported that Garzón had been urged to allow another judge, Ismail Moreno, to conduct the case, because he was still involved in the possible prosecution of Spanish former Guantanamo captives. Paul Havens, reporting for the ''[[Associated Press]]'' reported that an unnamed source within the Spanish prosecutors office had told him that the charges would be filed during the week of April 14, 2009.<ref name=AssociatedPress2009-04-14> {{cite news |url = https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5gw5KhIf6dRlptgQeY7ytP_39edTQD97I9JOO0 |date = April 14, 2009 |author = Paul Havens |title = Decision likely in US torture case in Spain |agency = [[Associated Press]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fhostednews%2Fap%2Farticle%2FALeqM5gw5KhIf6dRlptgQeY7ytP_39edTQD97I9JOO0&date=2009-04-14 |archivedate = April 14, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> ''[[CNN]]'', also quoting an unnamed source within the Spanish prosecutor's office, reported that charges were not expected for several days.<ref name=Cnn2009-04-14> {{cite news |url = http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/04/14/gonzales.spain.gitmo/ |title = Spanish court to decide over Bush officials trial |publisher = [[CNN]] |date = April 14, 2009 |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fedition.cnn.com%2F2009%2FWORLD%2Feurope%2F04%2F14%2Fgonzales.spain.gitmo%2F&date=2009-04-14 |archivedate = April 14, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
== Spanish Attorney General drops the charges ==
On April 16, 2009, the Spanish [[Attorney General]], [[Cándido Conde-Pumpido]] stated he thought the Spanish investigative magistrate should drop the consideration of charges against the six men.<ref name=Cnn2009-04-16> {{cite news |url = http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/04/16/spain.guantanamo/ |title = Prosecutor: Drop case against Bush officials |publisher = [[CNN]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnn.com%2F2009%2FWORLD%2Feurope%2F04%2F16%2Fspain.guantanamo%2F&date=2009-04-16 |date = April 16, 2009 |archivedate = April 16, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
On April 17, 2009, Spain's attorney general, [[Cándido Conde-Pumpido]], said his office would not support Judge Baltasar Garzon's effort to prosecute six Bush Administration officials for their role in the US antiterror effort. Spain's AG said any such prosecution would turn his nation's National Court "into a plaything" for politics.<ref>[https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB123993430198528009] Two Wins in the Terror War. The Wall Street Journal. April 17, 2009.</ref>
The Spanish Attorney General [[Cándido Conde-Pumpido]] believes that an American tribunal should judge the case (or dismiss it) before a Spanish Court ever thinks about becoming involved, prosecutors recommended that Judge should drop his investigation. As CNN reported, Mr. Conde-Pumpido told reporters that Judge’s plan threatened to turn the court “into a toy in the hands of people who are trying to do a political action”.
Under the Spanish justice system, investigating magistrates like Garzón are not under the authority of the Attorney General, and he can continue to consider laying charges even though the Attorney General has advised against it.<ref name=Cnn2009-04-16 />
On April 23, 2009, Eloy Velasco took over responsibility for determining whether or not the six former Bush officials should face Spanish charges.<ref name=Cnn2009-04-23> {{cite news |url = http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/04/23/spain.court.guantanamo/ |title = Spanish court sends Guantanamo case to new judge |date = April 23, 2009 |author = Al Goodman |publisher = [[CNN]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fedition.cnn.com%2F2009%2FWORLD%2Feurope%2F04%2F23%2Fspain.court.guantanamo%2F&date=2009-05-02 |archivedate = May 2, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
''[[The Guardian]]'' reported on April 29, 2009, that Garzón initiated a formal investigation into whether confessions from four former Guantanamo captives was the result of the use of abusive interrogation techniques.<ref name=TheGuardian2009-04-29> {{cite news |url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/apr/29/spain-court-guantanamo-detainees-torture |title = Spanish court opens investigation of Guantánamo torture allegations |date = April 29, 2009 |author = Giles Tremblett |work = [[The Guardian]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.guardian.co.uk%2Fworld%2F2009%2Fapr%2F29%2Fspain-court-guantanamo-detainees-torture&date=2009-04-29 |archivedate = April 29, 2009 |location = London |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=Afp2009-04-29> {{cite news |url = https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5iAI5j8L_T9-ohjwCcZOXPT7Bf95g |title = Spanish judge opens probe into Guantanamo torture |date = April 29, 2009 |agency = [[Agence France-Presse]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fhostednews%2Fafp%2Farticle%2FALeqM5iAI5j8L_T9-ohjwCcZOXPT7Bf95g&date=2009-04-29 |archivedate = April 29, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=TheTelegraph2009-04-29> {{cite news |url = http://blogs.telegraph.co.uk/news/geraldwarner/9658403/Spanish_judge_uses_memos_released_by_Barack_Obama_to_pursue_Bush_officials/ |title = Spanish judge uses memos released by Barack Obama to pursue Bush officials |date = April 29, 2009 |author = Gerald Warner |work = [[The Daily Telegraph]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fblogs.telegraph.co.uk%2Fgerald_warner%2Fblog%2F2009%2F04%2F29%2Fspanish_judge_uses_memos_released_by_barack_obama_to_pursue_bush_officials&date=2009-04-29 |archivedate = April 29, 2009 |location = London |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> The four men: [[Hamed Abderrahman Ahmed]], [[Lahcen Ikassrien]], [[Jamiel Abdul Latif al Banna]] and [[Omar Deghayes]], had previously faced charges in Spanish courts, based on confessions they made while in US custody. Their charges had been dropped based on their claims that their confessions were false and were the result of abusive interrogation techniques.
On May 5, 2009, Investigating Magistrate Eloy Velasco formally requested the USA to indicate whether they were going to conduct a domestic inquiry into the six men's conduct.<ref name=AssociatedPress2009-05-05> {{cite news |url = https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5gw5KhIf6dRlptgQeY7ytP_39edTQD9803BI84 |title = Spanish judge asks US if it will probe torture |date = May 5, 2009 |author = Daniel Woolls |agency = [[Associated Press]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fhostednews%2Fap%2Farticle%2FALeqM5gw5KhIf6dRlptgQeY7ytP_39edTQD9803BI84&date=2009-05-05 |archivedate = May 5, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> Spain's [[principle of universal justice]] allows third party states to charge non-citizens, and request their extradition, only when their country of citizenship has not conducted its own investigation.<ref name=AssociatedPress2009-05-05 />
On May 20, 2009, ''[[The New York Times]]'' reported that some Spanish legislators were proposing a law to strip investigating magistrates of the authority to pursue international human rights cases.<ref name=NYTimes2009-05-20> {{cite news |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2009/05/21/world/europe/21spain.html?bl&ex=1243051200&en=5e6557f1159edce7&ei=5087%0A |title = Push in Spain to Limit Reach of the Courts |date = May 20, 2009 |author = Victoria Burkett |author2 = Marlise Simons |work = [[The New York Times]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2009%2F05%2F21%2Fworld%2Feurope%2F21spain.html%3Fbl%26ex%3D1243051200%26en%3D5e6557f1159edce7%26ei%3D5087%250A&date=2009-05-21 |archivedate = May 21, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> This law, however, would not retroactively put an end to the progress of current cases. It would merely have stopped the initiation of similar cases.
According to historian [[Andy Worthington]], writing in the ''[[Huffington Post]]'', Spanish newspaper ''[[Público (Spain)|Público]]'' had reported that Garzón was proceeding to the next phase of his investigation.<ref name=HuffingtonPost2009-09-08> {{cite news |url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/andy-worthington/spanish-judge-resumes-tor_b_279451.html |title = Spanish Judge Resumes Torture Case Against Six Senior Bush Lawyers |date = September 8, 2009 |author = [[Andy Worthington]] |work = [[Huffington Post]] |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.huffingtonpost.com%2Fandy-worthington%2Fspanish-judge-resumes-tor_b_279451.html&date=2009-09-08 |archivedate = September 8, 2009 |deadurl = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> In February 2011, Judge Ruz rejected a Spanish prosecutor’s effort to stop the investigation.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.haguejusticeportal.net/eCache/DEF/12/407.html | title=US torture programme | date=February 7, 2011 | author=Julie McBride | publisher=[[The Hague Justice Portal]] | archiveurl=http://www.haguejusticeportal.net/eCache/DEF/12/407.html | archivedate=February 7, 2011 }}{{dead link|date=May 2014}}</ref>
== U.S. embassy cables == Numerous embassy cables leaked by the whistle-blowing website [[WikiLeaks]] centered on the progression of the case.<ref>{{cite web|last=Martin de Pozuelo|first=Eduardo|title=EE.UU. intentó frenar la investigación de Garzón sobre Guantánamo|url=http://www.lavanguardia.es/internacional/noticias/20101130/54077944789/ee.uu.-intento-frenar-la-investigacion-de-garzon-sobre-guantanamo.html|work=La Vanguardia|language=Spanish|date=2010-11-30|accessdate=2010-12-01}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Rosenberg|first=Carol|title=WikiLeaks: How U.S. tried to stop Spain's torture probe|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2010/12/25/v-fullstory/1988286/wikileaks-how-us-tried-to-stop.html|work=The Miami Herald|date=First published 2010 Dec 28|accessdate=2011-11-06 }}</ref><ref name="Nov 14 Guardian">{{cite news|last=Tremlett|first=Giles|title=Wikileaks: US pressured Spain over CIA rendition and Guantánamo torture|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/nov/30/wikileaks-us-spain-guantanamo-rendition?intcmp=239|work=The Guardian|accessdate=November 14, 2011|location=London|date=November 30, 2010}}</ref> On April 1, 2009 a summary of the case was sent to the U.S. State Department by the Madrid Embassy. The cable suggests that the U.S. had intended to convince Spanish Officials to interfere with the National Court's [[judicial independence]]:
<blockquote> we do not know if the government would be willing to take the risky step of trying behind the scenes to influence the prosecutor's recommendation on this case or what their reaction to such a request would be.<ref>{{cite web|title=PROSECUTOR WEIGHS GTMO CRIMINAL CASE VS. FORMER USG OFFICIALS|url=http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09MADRID347#para-693-12|publisher=WikiLeaks|accessdate=November 7, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118050908/http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09Madrid347#para-693-12#para-693-12|archive-date=January 18, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> </blockquote>
The cable reveals that Chief Prosecutor Javier Zaragoza intended to steer the case away from its assignment to Judge [[Baltasar Garzón]] who is well known for investigating a [[universal jurisdiction]] case targeting [[Chile]]an dictator [[Augusto Pinochet]] and has been an outspoken critic of the [[Guantanamo Bay detention camp|Guantanamo Bay detention facility]] and has publicly stated that former President [[George W. Bush]] should be tried for war crimes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09MADRID392|title=CABLE 09MADRID392, SPAIN: ATTORNEY GENERAL RECOMMENDS COURT NOT |publisher=Wikileaks.org |accessdate=2011-10-07}}</ref> Garzón was "forced to give up" the case against the Bush Six to another judge who declined to pursue the investigation.<ref name=Cnn2009-04-23 /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09MADRID467 |title=SCENESETTER FOR SECRETARY LAHOOD'S VISIT, MAY 29–30, 2009 |publisher=Wikileaks.org |accessdate=2011-10-07}}</ref> Garzón, however, continued an investigation into torture at Guantanamo Bay and U.S. Officials indicated in a cable they feared he may, "attempt to wring all the publicity he can from the case unless and until he is forced to give it up."<ref name=TheGuardian2009-04-29 />
U.S. Senators [[Mel Martinez]] and [[Judd Gregg]] lobbied on behalf of the U.S. government position as summarized in an embassy cable sent on April 17, 2009. Senator Martinez warned that, "the prosecutions would neither be understood nor accepted in the U.S. and would have an enormous impact on the bilateral relationship." Spanish Foreign Minister Angel Losada was quoted as saying, "the National Court had broad jurisdiction for universal justice and that there was no political influence on the judicial process."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09MADRID393 |title=SENATOR MEL MARTINEZ MEETINGS WITH DEPUTY FM LOSSADA AND MOD SECGEN CUESTA |publisher=Wikileaks.org |accessdate=November 5, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120119093751/http://www.cablegatesearch.net/cable.php?id=09Madrid393# |archive-date=January 19, 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref>

'''Capital Cost Allowance''' ('''CCA''') is the means by which [[Taxation in Canada|Canadian]] businesses may claim [[depreciation]] [[expense]] for calculating taxable income under the ''Income Tax Act'' (Canada). Similar allowances are in effect for calculating taxable income for provincial purposes.
==General rules for CCA calculation==
===Capital property===
Capital property eligible for CCA excludes:<ref>ITR s. 1102</ref>
* land * property the cost of which is deductible in computing the taxpayer's income * property that is described in the taxpayer's inventory * property that was not acquired for the purpose of gaining or producing income * property that was acquired by an expenditure in respect of which the taxpayer is allowed a deduction under section 37 * specified artwork and crafts acquired after November 12, 1981 * property that is a camp, yacht, lodge or golf course or facility acquired after December 31, 1974 if any outlay or expense for the use or maintenance of that property is not deductible by virtue of paragraph 18(1)(l)
CCA is calculated on ''undepreciated capital cost'' ("UCC"), which is generally defined as:{{sfn|IT-285R2|1994|loc=par. 2}}
* the capital cost of property that is acquired or made available for use (whichever is the later date) * ''plus'' legal, accounting, engineering or other fees incurred to acquire the property * ''plus'', in the case of a property a taxpayer manufactures for his own use, it includes material, labour and overhead costs reasonably attributable to the property, but nothing for any profit which might have been earned had the asset been sold * ''less'' the proceeds of disposition for a sold asset (but no greater than its original capital cost) * ''less'' any assistance (including tax credits) the taxpayer has received with respect to the acquisition of the property * ''less'' any CCA previously claimed with respect to the class
Where the UCC for a class is negative, a ''recapture of depreciation'' is deemed to take place, thus adding to taxable income and bringing the balance of UCC back to zero. Where UCC for a class is positive, but all assets with respect to that class have been disposed of, a ''terminal loss'' is deemed to take place, thus deducting from taxable income and bringing the balance of UCC back to zero.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/E/pub/tp/it478r2/it478r2-e.html|title = IT-478R2: Capital Cost Allowance - Recapture and Terminal Loss}}</ref>
===CCA calculation===
CCA itself is generally calculated using the following items:
:''CCA'' = capital cost allowance for the current fiscal period :''UCC'' = undepreciated capital cost before claiming CCA in the current fiscal period :''t'' = the proportion of days in the current fiscal period vs a normal fiscal period, if the current fiscal period is a stub, otherwise 1 :''d'' = the specified CCA rate with respect to the class :''a'' = acquisition cost of the property in the current fiscal period :''b'' = proceeds of disposition with respect to the property in the current fiscal period (but not greater than its original cost) :''c'' = assistance received with respect to the property in the current fiscal period (net of any repayments made)
For assets subject to the full-year rule:
<math>CCA = tdUCC</math><ref>ITR s. 1100(1)</ref>
For assets subject to the half-year rule:
<math>CCA = tdUCC - \frac{1}{2}td\left ( a - b - c \right )</math><ref>ITR s. 1100(2)</ref>
===Types of allowance===
Under the ''Income Tax Act'':<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/I-3.3/index.html|title = ''Income Tax Act'' (R.S.C., 1985, c. 1 (5th Supp.))}}</ref>
* paragraph 18(1)(b) prohibits the deduction of any outlay, loss or replacement of capital, payment on account of capital or any allowance for depreciation, obsolescence or depletion, unless specifically allowed in Part I of the Act. * paragraph 20(1)(a) allows a deduction, in computing the income from a business or property, of any amount allowed by regulation in respect of the capital cost of a property.{{sfn|IT-285R2|1994|loc=par. 1}}
Part XI of the ''Income Tax Regulations'' provides for the calculation rules for CCA,<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.,_c._945/page-45.html#h-105 |title=ITR Part XI |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121227115959/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.%2C_c._945/page-45.html#h-105 |archivedate=2012-12-27 |df= }}</ref> and Schedule II outlines the various classes of capital property that are eligible for it.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.,_c._945/page-220.html#h-448 |title=ITR Schedule II |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121224040746/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.%2C_c._945/page-220.html#h-448 |archivedate=2012-12-24 |df= }}</ref> Special rules are in place to deem certain assets to be in separate classes, thus not becoming part of the general pool for the class.<ref>ITR s. 1102</ref> Certain elections are available to taxpayers to transfer or reclassify assets from one class to another.<ref>ITR s. 1103</ref>
Additional allowances are prescribed with respect to specified circumstances.<ref>ITR s. 1100(1)</ref> Specialized calculations for certain classes are also outlined in:
* Schedule III for property in Class 13 ([[leasehold]] interests)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.,_c._945/page-221.html#h-449 |title=ITR Schedule III |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121224040037/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.%2C_c._945/page-221.html#h-449 |archivedate=2012-12-24 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/E/pub/tp/it464r/it464r-e.html|title = IT-464R: Capital Cost Allowance - Leasehold Interests}}</ref> * Schedule IV for property in Class 15 (property for cutting and removing timber from a timber limit)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.,_c._945/page-222.html#h-450 |title=ITR Schedule IV |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121224042833/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.%2C_c._945/page-222.html#h-450 |archivedate=2012-12-24 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/E/pub/tp/it501/it501-e.html|title = IT-501: Capital Cost Allowance - Logging Assets}}</ref> * Schedule V for property relating to [[industrial mineral]] mines<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.,_c._945/page-223.html#h-451 |title=ITR Schedule V |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121224040942/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.%2C_c._945/page-223.html#h-451 |archivedate=2012-12-24 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/E/pub/tp/it492/it492-e.html|title = IT-492: Capital Cost Allowance - Industrial Mineral Mines}}</ref> * Schedule VI for property relating to timber limits and cutting rights<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.,_c._945/page-224.html#h-452 |title=ITR Schedule VI |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121224035857/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.%2C_c._945/page-224.html#h-452 |archivedate=2012-12-24 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/E/pub/tp/it481-consolid/it481-consolid-e.html|title = IT-481 (Consolidated): Timber Resource Property and Timber Limits}}</ref>
Part XVII of the ''Income Tax Regulations'' provides for specialized calculation rules for CCA with respect to capital property acquired for use in earning income from farming and fishing.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.,_c._945/page-71.html |title=ITR Part XVII |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150922053007/http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/C.R.C.%2C_c._945/page-71.html |archivedate=2015-09-22 |df= }}</ref>
===Typical classes of assets for CCA purposes=== CCA is calculated under the half-year rule, except where otherwise specified, with respect to the following classes.
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Class ! Rate ! Description |- | 1 | 4% | Buildings acquired after 1987 |- | 3 | 5% | Building acquired before 1988 |- | 7 | 15% | Canoes and boats (including their fittings, furniture and equipment) |- | 8 | 20% | Assets not included in other classes (common examples include furniture, equipment not used for manufacturing and processing, and tools costing more than $500) |- | 9 | 25% | Aircraft |- | 10 | 30% | Automobiles (including passenger vehicles costing less than $30,000, trucks, vans, etc. - but not taxis), computer equipment and systems software for that equipment |- | 10.1 | 30% | Passenger vehicles costing more than $30,000 (including taxes). Each vehicle must be kept in a separate class, and no terminal loss may be claimed. |- | rowspan="2"|12<ref>{{cite web|title=Classes of depreciable property|url=http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/tx/bsnss/tpcs/slprtnr/rprtng/cptl/dprcbl-eng.html|work=Canada Revenue Agency|accessdate=6 May 2013}}</ref> | 100% (full-year rule) | * medical or dental instruments and kitchen utensils, costing less than $500 * tools costing less than $500 * computer software (except systems software, which is in class 10) * video-cassettes, video-laser discs, and digital video disks for short-term rental |- | 100% (half-year rule)<ref>{{cite web|title=Capital Cost Allowance Rates|url=http://www.taxtips.ca/smallbusiness/ccarates.htm|work=TaxTips.ca|accessdate=6 May 2013}}</ref><ref>ITR, s. 1100(2)(a)(iii)</ref> | * a die, jig, pattern, mould or last * the cutting or shaping part in a machine * a motion picture film or video tape that is a television commercial message * a certified feature film or certified production |- | 13 | Original lease period plus one renewal period (Minimum 5 years and Maximum 40 years) | Improvements made to leased premises |- | 14 | Length of life of property (full-year rule) | [[Franchising|Franchises]], Concessions, [[Patent]]s, and Licences |- | 17 | 8% | Parking lots |- | 29 | 50% straight-line (effectively allocated 25%-50%-25% over three years) | Eligible machinery and equipment used in Canada to manufacture and process goods for sale or lease, acquired after March 18, 2007, and before 2016 that would otherwise be included in Class 43. |- | 43 | 30% | Manufacturing and processing equipment not included in class 29 - may be kept in separate classes by filing an election |- | 44 | | Patents acquired after April 26, 1993 |- | 45 | 45% |Computer equipment and systems software acquired after March 22, 2004 and before March 19, 2007 |- | 46 | 30% | Data network equipment acquired after March 22, 2004 |- | 50 | 55% |Computer equipment and systems software acquired after March 18, 2007 |- | 52 | 100% (full-year rule) |Computer equipment and systems software acquired after January 27, 2009 and before February 2011. Only applies to new equipment used in Canada. |- |}
In contrast to the practice followed in the United States for depreciation there is no penalty for failing to claim Capital Cost Allowance. Where a taxpayer claims less than the amount of CCA to which he is entitled the pool remains intact, and available for claims in future years. Unclaimed amounts are not subject to recapture.
==[[Capital budgeting|Capital investment appraisal]] under CCA rules==
Because assets subject to CCA are generally pooled by class, and CCA is generally calculated on a declining-balance basis, specific techniques have been developed to determine the net present after-tax value of such capital investments. For standard scenarios under the full-year rule and half-year rule models, the following standard items are employed:{{sfn|Edge|Irvine|1981|p=64}}
:''I'' = Investment :''d'' = CCA rate per year for tax purposes :''t'' = rate of taxation :''n'' = number of years :''i'' = [[cost of capital]], rate of interest, or minimum rate of return (whichever is most relevant)
More specialized analysis would need to be applied to:
:* assets with specific lives (i.e. Classes 13 and 14) :* assets with non-standard rate calculations (i.e. Class 29) :* assets that are deemed to constitute a separate class of property, thus not becoming part of a capital cost pool :* scenarios where disposal values at a future date are part of the appraisal calculation, leading to a deduction from the capital cost pool, a recapture of depreciation, or the calculation of a taxable capital gain
===Full-year rule===
Capital cost allowance will be calculated as follows:{{sfn|Edge|Irvine|1981|pp=64{{endash}}65}}
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Calculated CCA |- |1 |<math>Id</math> |- |2 |<math>Id(1-d)</math> |- |3 |<math>Id(1-d)^2</math> |- |''n'' |<math>Id(1-d)^{n-1}</math> |}
Therefore, the [[Tax shield]] in year ''n'' = <math>Itd(1-d)^{n-1}</math>, and the present value of the taxation credits will be equal to <math>Itd \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{(1-d)^{n-1}}{(1+i)^n}</math>
As this is an example of a converging series for a [[geometric progression]], this can be simplified further to become:
<math>PV = \frac{Itd}{i+d}</math>
The net present after-tax value of a capital investment then becomes:
<math>I \left (1-\frac{td}{i+d}\right )</math>{{sfn|Edge|Irvine|1981|p=65}}
===Half-year rule===
For capital investments where CCA is calculated under the half-year rule, the CCA tax shield calculation is modified as follows:
<math>\begin{align} PV & = \frac{1}{2}\left (\frac{Itd}{i+d}\right ) + \frac{1}{2}\left (\frac{Itd}{i+d}\right )\left (\frac{1}{1+i}\right ) \\ & =\frac{Itd}{i+d}\left [\frac{1}{2} + \frac{\frac{1}{2}}{1+i}\right ] \\ & =\frac{Itd}{i+d}\left [\frac{\frac{1}{2}\left (1+i\right ) + \frac{1}{2}}{1+i}\right ] \\ & =\left (\frac{Itd}{i+d}\right )\left (\frac{1+\frac{1}{2}i}{1+i}\right ) \\ \end{align}</math>
Therefore, the net present after-tax value of a capital investment is determined to be:
<math>I \left [ 1-\left (\frac{td}{i+d}\right )\left (\frac{1+\frac{1}{2}i}{1+i}\right ) \right ]</math>
==Case Law==
In cases where claims have been contested or disallowed by the Canada Revenue Agency, the Supreme Court of Canada has interpreted the Capital Cost Allowance in a fairly broad manner, allowing deductions on property which was owned for a very brief period of time,<ref>{{cite CanLII|litigants=Hickman Motors Ltd. v. Canada|link=|year=1997|court=scc|num=357|format=canlii|parallelcite=[1997] 2 SCR 336|date=1997-06-26}}</ref> and property which is leased back to the vendor from which it originated.<ref>{{cite CanLII|litigants=Canada Trustco Mortgage Co. v. Canada|link=|year=2005|court=scc|num=54|parallelcite=[2005] 2 SCR 601|date=2005-10-19}}</ref> These decisions demonstrate the flexibility of the Capital Cost Allowance as a legal tax reduction strategy.
==See also== *[[Income taxes in Canada]] *[[MACRS]] - Modified Accelerated Cost Recovery System - [[Taxation in the United States|U.S.]] [[Internal Revenue Code]] *[[Capital cost tax factor]]
==References== {{reflist|3}}
==Further reading==
* {{Cite web|url = http://www.parl.gc.ca/Content/LOP/ResearchPublications/prb0606-e.pdf|title = PRB 06-06E: Capital Cost Allowance|author = Sheena Starky|publisher = [[Library of Parliament]]|date = 3 April 2006|accessdate = 5 March 2013}} * {{cite book |author= Rose Filice|edition= 2nd|title= Capital Cost Allowance in Canada|url= https://books.google.com/books?id=5uU-5gfjKvQC&lpg=PP1&pg=PP1#v=onepage&q&f=false|accessdate= 5 March 2013|year= 2005|publisher= [[CCH Canadian Limited]]|location= Toronto|isbn= 1-55367-511-8|page= |pages=833|ref={{harvid|Filice|2005}}}} * {{Cite web|url = http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/E/pub/tp/it285r2/it285r2-e.html|title = Interpretation Bulletin IT-285R2: Capital Cost Allowance - General Comments|ref={{harvid|IT-285R2|1994}}}} * {{Cite web|url = http://www.cra-arc.gc.ca/tx/bsnss/tpcs/slprtnr/rprtng/cptl/clsss-eng.html|title = CCA Classes}} * {{cite book |author1= C. Geoffrey Edge|author2= V. Bruce Irvine|authorlink= |title= A Practical Approach to the Appraisal of Capital Expenditures|url= |year= 1981|publisher= [[Society of Management Accountants of Canada]]|location= Hamilton|isbn= 0-920212-29-8|page= |pages=|ref={{harvid|Edge|Irvine|1981}}}}<!--|accessdate= 26 February 2013-->
